title: 105_s1674
content: Legal Reform Commission Act of 1998 - Establishes the Legal Reform Commission to study, develop recommendations regarding, and report to the President and the Congress on the reform and simplification of the US legal system. Requires matters studied by the Commission to include reform of: (1) Federal, State, criminal, and civil law, (2) judicial, trial and appellate processes. And (3) the Federal Rules of Evidence, Civil Procedure, and Criminal Procedure. Authorizes appropriations.
